title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored the game-sealing goal for the Boston Bruins in a 5-3 win over the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Minten, traded to Boston from Toronto last season, returned to Toronto for a game against his former team.
The victory marks Boston's sixth consecutive win and Minten's third goal of the 2025-26 NHL season.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame, receiving his ring and plaque in Toronto.
Chara shared the induction experience with fellow 2025 inductee Joe Thornton, though they never played together in Boston.
Chara's career highlights include a Stanley Cup win, seven All-Star selections, and a Norris Trophy for top defenseman.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are active in free agency with $219 million payroll, aiming to sign top free agents like Bregman.
Alex Bregman favored to re-sign with Boston, projected contracts around six years, $160-171 million.
Red Sox among potential suitors for Kyle Schwarber and Pete Alonso, seeking power hitters and first baseman.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway in Boston on November 7, 2025.
The concert celebrated 20 years since his debut album, 'Get Lifted,' featuring a mix of hits and covers.
Legend's performance included songs like 'All Of Me,' 'Used To Love U,' and covers from artists like Lauryn Hill and The Beatles.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown appeared to criticize NBA officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic.
Brown previously expressed frustration with referees following a controversial no-call in a 105-103 loss to the Jazz.
Despite his remarks, Brown was not fined, and the NBA acknowledged a missed call in the game against the Jazz.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers QB Baker Mayfield is an MVP candidate with 1,919 yards and 13 touchdowns but struggles with short throws.
Rookie wide receiver Emeka Egbuka has 562 yards and five touchdowns despite recent injuries and struggles against man coverage.
Buccaneers defense ranks seventh in overall DVOA, with standout performances from Vita Vea, YaYa Diaby, Jamel Dean, and Antoine Winfield Jr.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS, marking their first Patriots game aired since 2023.
The Patriots have regained relevance with new quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel, attracting CBS's top announcer team.
Jim Nantz highlighted his connections with Drake Maye, looking forward to covering the emerging quarterback's performance on Sunday.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost to the Orlando Magic 123-110, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup series.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points but struggled with his three-point shooting, going 1-for-6 from beyond the arc.
Boston's defense allowed the Magic to make 17 threes, outscoring them heavily in the first and fourth quarters.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces a public reprimand for creating an appearance of impropriety during a 2018 ICE-related incident.
Hearing officer Denis McInerney recommended the reprimand, finding no evidence Joseph authorized a defendant's escape from ICE custody.
In 2019, Joseph and a court officer were charged with obstruction of justice, but charges were dropped in 2022.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora is optimistic about the Red Sox's future despite their early postseason exit against the Yankees.
Trevor Story opted in to his contract with Boston, but Alex Bregman opted out ahead of the offseason.
Red Sox finished the 2025 season with an 89-73 record, marked by roster changes and player performance fluctuations.
